items.title: Jewish groups say vilification laws should be revisited as hate bill passes
items.description: Labor's watered-down hate law reform has passed the Senate with the support of the Liberal Party but not the Nationals, who opposed the legislation due to freedom of speech concerns.

items.title: The 'perfect storm' that has led to NSW's high shark attack numbers
items.description: New South Wales has experienced the highest number of shark attacks for January across the state in the last decade, according to the Australian Shark Incident Database.

items.title: Gen Z want their online order and they want it now
items.description: Small retailers are scrambling to keep up with deliveries as research shows Australian shoppers are expecting the same ultra-fast delivery they get from retail giants like Amazon. But some entrepreneurs have more than a few tricks up their sleeves to satisfy gen Z.

items.title: 'Devastating': Home buyer's application challenged over new boyfriend
items.description: Erin Bell's efforts to both buy a house and build a new one through a government scheme were repeatedly challenged — once because she had disclosed a new boyfriend.

items.title: Inside the program teaching US ICE agents to 'Defend the Homeland'
items.description: For the thousands of "patriots" who've applied, a position with ICE is a source of pride. Experts, elected officials and activists say otherwise.

items.title: Donald Trump, the madman theory, and why even Australia is not safe
items.description: One year into Trump's second term, something has become clear: even those who leave the Oval Office with a deal, beware. It might not be worth the paper it's written on.

items.title: NSW's first female governor Dame Marie Bashir dies aged 95
items.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns says a state funeral will be held for the veteran public servant, who he describes as "an extraordinary Australian".

items.title: Religious restrictions, compulsory fasting: Samoa PM's 'radical' Christian agenda
items.description: Samoa's prime minister has thrown the future of its religious minorities into doubt after flagging potential restrictions on non-Christian faiths.

items.title: Osaka brings fashion to the court as plucky Aussies progress to second round
items.description: Seeing Naomi Osaka don a jellyfish-inspired outfit was one highlight of day three of the tournament, however two plucky Australians — Dane Sweeny and James Duckworth also put on a show.

items.title: China's air force 'a potentially revolutionary threat' to Indo-Pacific, report says
items.description: Certain capabilities of China's air force now seriously challenge those of the US and other Western countries, with experts saying that it could tip the balance of any war over Taiwan in Beijing's favour.

items.title: Massive Chinese embassy in London approved despite 'nest of spies' concerns
items.description: The new embassy will sit in the city's Royal Mint Court alongside London's famous financial hub, despite experts and human rights groups raising concerns about foreign interference.

items.title: Petty crime or growing nuisance? A look at the world of plant theft
items.description: Data shows more than 2,000 items were reported stolen from gardens over a year in one state alone. So what can plant owners do to protect their beloved greenery from theft?

items.title: Death of Tim Picton puts spotlight on Australia's 'one-punch' laws
items.description: The death of Labor identity Tim Picton more than three weeks after he was allegedly assaulted outside a Perth nightclub has shocked Australia's political and business worlds and put the nation's one-punch laws under the microscope.

items.title: Invasion Day rallies are going ahead. Here's what they mean for First Peoples
items.description: Invasion Day rallies will go ahead on Monday after being exempted from NSW protest bans. Here's the story of how they started in the first place.

items.title: Sisters faced off for the first time and an iconic sibling rivalry began
items.description: On this day in 1998, Venus and Serena Williams faced off for the first time at a Grand Slam tournament, starting an iconic sibling rivalry that would last two decades.

items.title: Could Paul Kelly and Hilltop Hoods break records in triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025?
items.description: Here's what might go down when triple j unveils the Hottest 100 of 2025 this Saturday.

items.title: 50/50 quiz: Test your knowledge of the Beatles, Lost, champagne and floating planets
items.description: Every question has only two options: One is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

items.title: David Beckham breaks silence after son Brooklyn cuts ties
items.description: The football superstar told broadcasters at the World Economic Forum that "children are allowed to make mistakes" in his first public comments since his son's allegations went public.

items.title: 'Wasn't I smart': Hanson celebrates historic rise in polls
items.description: While she's made no secret of her desire to eventually unseat Anthony Albanese, the One Nation leader's immediate electoral strategy is to gain ground at upcoming state elections.

items.title: 'Massive impact': Midnight Oil founder and drummer Rob Hirst dies aged 70
items.description: Rob Hirst was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023.

items.title: What is Trump's Board of Peace and why could it be a threat to the UN?
items.description: Donald Trump appears to be trying to build his own international peacekeeping body, which he calls the "Board of Peace". Here's why experts think it might attempt to rival the UN.

items.title: Kim Jong Un fires vice premier describing him as 'a goat yoked to pull an ox cart'
items.description: The North Korean leader blamed Yang Sun Ho for "confusion" and cost blow-outs at a factory project in the country's north-east.

items.title: MPs can still take partners, kids on work trips under new family travel rules
items.description: Politicians can still charge taxpayers for taking their partners and children on work-related trips outside Canberra under tighter new rules set independently.

items.title: Viral lookout inundated by thousands of daily visitors set to close
items.description: A council will shut an iconic Blue Mountains cliff after being overrun with tourists, sparking serious safety and environmental concerns.

items.title: Israel starts demolishing former UN aid agency headquarters
items.description: The UN has labelled Israel's move to bulldoze a former UNRWA headquarters a  "serious violation of international law".
